result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew James Grisell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation no later than December 5, 2016 by 12:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apply bond on file.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with recommendations.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis McKinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Andrew James Grisell appeared. Case called at 2:49 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Atty Andrea recites agreement. State has complied with Victims Rights.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct and without enhancer in 15CM627. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct without enhancer in 15CM627.  Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal.

 Crt orders:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to probation no later than noon on Monday, December 5, 2016. 

- $243.00 Court Costs

- DNA Sample and $200.00 Surcharge

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  Complete a domestic abuse assessment and follow through with recommendations
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Andrew James Grisell appeared. Case called at 3:55 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for Motion Hearing. Atty Andrea states issue is regarding suppression of  statements only. If there is any other statements outside the police report. Requesting a stipulation from the State. ADA McKinley does not believe there is anything outside of the report. Atty Andrea gives argument. Court makes statement. S/T Steven Ryan. Deputy with St Croix County. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Andrea. Witness excused. Court will DENY the DE's motion to Suppress Statements. Atty Andrea makes a speedy trial demand. Court orders all pre trial submissions to be filed no later than 08-05-2016. Anything that is not filed on time is subject to exclusion.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

per Defendant's bond. eif
Pre-trial conference at 03-02-2016 09:00 am

Bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ms. Pinuelas.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
